Author: Regnar#6164
Content: as far as I'm aware from reading in the scaling sections, Komodo scaling is not through the asset chains that are set up on it, it's about scaling the Komodo current chain with asset chains that are fungible with it. it's not saying there are 100 asset chains, each their own project and coins, therefore KMD tx/s is X(#of asset chains). it's saying Komodo can launch multiple of its own chains that are all KMD (not other projects) and all fungible with it, therefore providing n chains of Komodo. I don't think I've read anywhere that these asset chains don't need their own resources to scale either.

Author: ProficieNt#3097
Content: so it is relatively formal opinion held by Komodo

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
I think there seems to be a conflation of things here.
the chains that spin up for scale are not the same as the chains that get spun as asset chains
If KMD needs more headspace, the assets like MNZ and others aren't going to get flooded with transactions; these are separate from that

Author: Meyse#0952
Content: Okay so as far as my technical skills go its like this: everyone can create an "assetchain", you can secure this assetchain with the notaries through dPoW. If you need lets say 1m tx/s, you create a whole bunch of assetchains and link them together, with the whole MoMoM thing, so they act as "one". These are also secured with dPoW then. EVERY assetchain needs their own PoW/PoS/whatever

Author: ProficieNt#3097
Content:
``

Secure this Assetchain with Delayed Proof of Work
Your new chain can be secured via dPOW by the Komodo notary nodes giving it Bitcoin level security. The current rate for this is 300 KMD and 800 of the coin to be secured per year. If you are interested in having a new chain notarized, please contact @siu or @PTYX on the Komodo discord.

@PTYX has launched ChainZilla and @siu:matrix.org has launched ChainMakers to provide assetchain creation, electrum server, explorer, dICO services.

Please send any critique or feedback to Alright or gcharang on matrix or discord.

``

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: I have access to both the docs at readthedocs and atlassian. The problem is, scaling solution is still in testing and it uses the exact same technology of asset chain creation(but enhanced with MoMoM stuff). For the assetchain/parallel chain part, they both mean the exact same thing and there were plans to phase out both the terms and make it just `blockchain` we will need to finalise all these either as a team or as a community which is a problem because of all the `decentralization`. There is no CEO here to say this is the final truth and make it so.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: TXSCL chains are Komodo assetchains like any other AC we have. the difference is they are clustered using `-ac_cc=3`. If any other real projects wants to use `-ac_cc=x` they can. those will not be classed as scaling chains

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: just to add in from above my opinion (from my understanding).  since the scaling chains are essentially assetchains with  -ac_cc=3  or whatever it is, I'm not sure 2 names is really necessary. In the future wouldn't we want to promote anyone who's spawning an assetchain to include  -ac_cc=3  no matter what the purpose of their chain is?  that way in the future if they ever need to take advantage of the CC features, they don't need to create a new chain just to add this paramater
